title: Clash fairness with honor0 smurfs

UPVOTE IF YOU WANT RIOT SEE IT

Having an alt account in the same or around the same rank as your original is perfectly fine, because its not like you can roflstomp and ruin someone elses promos or something.
Diamond 1 and diamond 5 are different

Diamond+ is Tier 1 whether it'd be Diamond 5 or Challenger and Tier 1 teams are gonna be matched together for brackets (hence why the winning teams in that tier were LCS-level rosters). Them playing on lower elo accounts isn't gonna change this enough for it to really be that much of an issue. 

It's not like a P2 (Tier 2) player's playing on a B4 acc (Tier 4).
You just quoted what im currently doing

Apparently smurfing is now a crime

The reality of the situation is that imaqtpie and cowsep are not toxic players currently, the only reason imaqtpie got chat restricted was that enough people thought it was funny to report him to get him restricted.

The reality of smurfing is that it will almost never affect your games. There are so many players in bronze/silver/gold that smurfs will rapidly outrank your tier.

smurfing is actually a pretty shitty thing to do and I've always said so, more people agree now

How much of a dick do you have to be to intentionally go into a lower ELO, gimping yourself of XP rewards in the process, just to get a free stomp game.. why? because you're not good enough?

It's like getting drunk and fighting people weaker than you when you have six friends on your side, it's actually a dick thing to do and is very fucking unsportsmanlike
thats the small amount of smurfs. i have 5 smurfs that i dont want anywhere near people in gold/ silver but i have to rank up somehow

>Apparently smurfing is now a crime 

Pretty sure Smurfing has always been a ToS violation. Riot just turns a blind eye to it most of the time (by their own admission).

The reason they turn a blind eye to it is because it's just not feasible to with the way Riot runs things currently.

If it were a paid game, it'd be easier to prevent future smurfs, but they'd have an even *harder* time handling smurfs already made.
It's actually pretty simple. Link accounts to phone numbers, and ever 3 or so months you have to do a confirmation number that is sent to your phone.

Riot has encouraged smurfing for way too long for them to back out on it now. They don't care that people smurf and ruin others games.  They encourage it.  Just get used to it.  That's all you can do. Riot won't do anything to combat smurfs ruining games.
What in God's name would you like them to do?

Several Things could be done.  IP / MAC address screening.  yes I know VPN for IP and MAC spoof.  But a VPN causes massive lag unless you pay high dollar.  MAC address spoofing is not near as commonly done.  You could also pull part numbers from PC's.  IE Video card / Mother Board - so on and so forth.  There are many things you could do to end smurfing in clash.

And how do you distinguish between the two siblings that have to share the same computer with that method? Or between all the players that visit an internet cafe?

The phone number is their attempt to limit smurfing, figuring most people have one number and they'll link it to their main.

Easy way to do this would be champions played.  Though I understand their are pitfalls with my method also .... 

The huge pitfall with Riots current method is Textplus / Pinger and a ton of other apps that give you a free phone number.  I currently have 3 phone numbers you can call right now ... and all ring through to 1 singular phone.
Those are all VoIP numbers and actually fairly easy to detect and deny.
It's actually pretty simple. Link accounts to phone numbers, and ever 3 or so months you have to do a confirmation number that is sent to your phone.

I won't be able to play League for the same reason I can't play Clash. I'm not a resident of the US and hence, no US phone number. For whatever reason, my phone number doesn't work. I'm assuming right now it's because it only works with US phone numbers.
Yes, clash has only been released in certain countries atm. But if they where to implent a system they would include every country. Obviously

The fact that Riot does nothing to have the players act professional is a big giveaway that they are above any rules that may be present for everybody else.  It happens in more places than just league of legends. Examples can be seen everywhere from the entertainment industry to the business world to politics.
